design_system.name: Sentinel Academic
design_system.description: A professional, institutional interface that balances academic clarity with the technical aesthetic of surveillance systems. Prioritizes data legibility and video visibility.

usage_rules.headings: Use Manrope for all page titles and card headers. Weight: 600 or 700. Tracking: tight.
usage_rules.body: Use Inter for all standard text. Weight: 400 or 500.
usage_rules.data: Use JetBrains Mono for timestamps, confidence scores, IP addresses, and log entries.

usage.primary_action: Use functional.primary for main buttons (Start Surveillance).
usage.alerts: Use functional.danger for 'Incident Detected' badges and borders.
usage.gradients: AVOID gradients. Use flat, solid colors for an institutional look.

rules: Use p-4 or p-6 for main containers.
Use gap-2 or gap-3 for data grids (high density).
Use p-2 for table cells to maximize information density.

specifics.cards: Flat background (surface), 1px border, no shadow in dark mode, subtle shadow-sm in light mode.
specifics.inputs: Background: transparent. Border: 1px solid input. Focus: ring-2 ring-primary/20.
specifics.video_feed: Must have a 'Viewfinder' overlay (corner brackets) to simulate a camera feed interface.

images.description: Abstract white wavy surface with grid pattern. Use as a subtle background texture for the login page or empty states in Light Mode.
images.usage: Login Page Background, Empty State Placeholder

images.description: Black camera lens close up. Use for 'Camera Offline' or 'No Signal' states.
White round light bulb/camera on white wall. Use for 'About' or 'System Info' cards.

rules: Use simple fades (opacity-0 to opacity-100) for modal entrances.
Use subtle color transitions for hover states.

setup: Install 'clsx' and 'tailwind-merge' if not present (already in package.json).
Ensure 'lucide-react' is used for all icons.
Add the Google Fonts link to the public/index.html file immediately.
implementation_priorities: 1. Create the 'Layout' component with the Sidebar and Header.
2. Build the 'VideoFeed' component with the custom 'Viewfinder' overlay (CSS borders on corners).
3. Implement the 'IncidentLog' component using a dense table or list view.
4. Ensure the 'ThemeToggle' works correctly (using 'next-themes' or manual class toggling).
critical_constraints: DO NOT use gradients for backgrounds. Keep it flat and professional.
Ensure the 'Incident Detected' alert is visually distinct (Red border + Red badge).
The video feed must be responsive. Use 'aspect-video' class.

universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) sparingly, only for overlays.
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: 'transition: all'. This results in breaking transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations.
NEVER use AI assistant Emoji characters for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable in the 'Marketing' sections, but keep 'Dashboard' sections dense.
All interactive and key informational elements MUST include a 'data-testid' attribute.
